intro: Balsamodendrum planifrons, commonly known as the flat-fruited balsamodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with five petals. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Balsamodendrum planifrons is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
